revision.text:
{{Infobox USB Hub |image1 = <!-- Image filename --> |image1_size = <!-- Image size, ex.150px --> |caption = <!-- tagline --> |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = <!-- product page url only --> |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = <!-- wikidevi.wi-cat.ru page, included underscores --> |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none -->
|brand = D-Link |model = DUB-H7 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = C1 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 12/19/2014 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/D-Link DUB-H7 rev C1 |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |series = <!-- Device series -->
|usb_ver = 2.0 |conn = Female B |size_class = desktop
|vendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |vendor_id2 = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id2 = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number -->
|controller_num = 2 |chip1 = Genesys Logic;GL850Z; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|pwr_optional = true |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|ports = 7 |tt = single |power_led = blue |port_led = |flags = <!-- Leave blank for none -->
|is_manuf = No |manuf = MCT |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 790069252389 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0000B0DL7 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Taiwan
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The hub presents itself to the host system as two USB devices, :indicating that GL850Z is actually two chained hubs internally. :The '''[[Genesys Logic]]''' chip is marked with "GL850Z", "MN1HA02G01", and "348S2P6021". :Datasheet and block diagram for GL850Z are available [http://www.genesyslogic.com/en/product_view.php?show=21 GL850Z]. :All capacitors used are from '''CapXon'''.
The power adapter included with the hub is a '''Jentec''' CF-1805-B :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.4A -> 5VDC 3A).
==Links of Interest== *[https://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/D-Link+7-Port+USB+2.0+HUB+Model+No.+DUB-H7+HW+Ver.+C1+UPC+Code+790069252389+Teardown/31436 D-Link 7-Port USB 2.0 HUB Model No. DUB-H7 HW Ver.C1 Teardown on '''iFixit'''] *[http://www.gearnuts.com/store/detail/USBHub7DLink Pictures on ''Gear Nuts'']
:Note that (in this revision anyway) this is one of the few USB hubs actually :capable of per-port power control (on/off), through the use as software tools :such as [https://github.com/codazoda/hub-ctrl.c/ hub-ctrl.c] on Unix (or more generally, libusb)
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery mode="slideshow"> File:D-link_DUB-H7revC2_PCB_TOP.jpg|top File:D-link_DUB-H7revC2_PCB_BOT.jpg|bottom </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]]
